intro: Selago chalarantha, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant is characterized by its small, pale green leaves and clusters of white or pale blue flowers. It produces small, round berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Selago chalarantha is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
